results.name: Expansion of Jacobi theta function (theta_3(q^(1/3))-theta_2(q^3))/2/q^(1/12).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10034
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Jacobi Theta Functions
I. J. Zucker, Further Relations Amongst Infinite Series and Products. II. The Evaluation of Three-Dimensional Lattice Sums, J. Phys. A: Math. Gen. 23, 117-132, 1990.
formula: Euler transform of period 12 sequence [0, 1, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, -1, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 13 2005
a(n) = b(12n+1) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(3^e)=0^e, b(p^e)=(1+(-1)^e)/2 if p<>3. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 06 2005
Expansion of q^(-1/12)(eta(q^4)eta(q^6)^2)/(eta(q^2)eta(q^12)) in powers of q.
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1+x^(2*k)) * (1-x^(6*k)) / (1+x^(6*k)), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 05 2016 *)
